Class ServicePoint

java.lang.Object
simu.model.ServicePoint
public class ServicePoint extends Object
Represents a service point in the cafeteria simulation. A service point manages a queue of customers and processes them using a service time generator. Examples include meal stations, payment stations, and coffee station.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServicePoint

      public ServicePoint(ContinuousGenerator generator, EventList tapahtumalista, EventType tyyppi)
      Constructs a new ServicePoint with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      generator - The service time generator
      tapahtumalista - The event list for scheduling events
      tyyppi - The event type to schedule when service completes

    • ServicePoint

      public ServicePoint(ContinuousGenerator generator, EventList tapahtumalista, EventType tyyppi, String name)
      Constructs a new ServicePoint with the specified parameters and name.
      Parameters:
      generator - The service time generator
      tapahtumalista - The event list for scheduling events
      tyyppi - The event type to schedule when service completes
      name - The name of the service point

  • Method Details

    • addQueue

      public void addQueue(Customer a)
      Adds a customer to the service point queue. Throws an exception if the service point is disabled.
      Parameters:
      a - The customer to add to the queue
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the service point is disabled

    • removeQueue

      public Customer removeQueue()
      Removes and returns the customer at the front of the queue (who just completed service). Also clears the reserved flag.
      Returns:
      The customer who completed service, or null if queue is empty

    • beginService

      public void beginService()
      Begins service for the customer at the front of the queue. Generates a service time and schedules a departure event. Does nothing if the service point is disabled or already reserved.

    • isReserved

      public boolean isReserved()
      Checks if the service point is currently reserved (serving a customer).
      Returns:
      true if reserved, false otherwise

    • isOnQueue

      public boolean isOnQueue()
      Checks if there are customers in the queue.
      Returns:
      true if queue is not empty, false otherwise

    • isEnabled

      public boolean isEnabled()
      Checks if the service point is enabled.
      Returns:
      true if enabled, false otherwise

    • setEnabled

      public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
      Sets whether the service point is enabled.
      Parameters:
      enabled - true to enable, false to disable

    • getQueueLength

      public int getQueueLength()
      Gets the current queue length (number of customers waiting or being served).
      Returns:
      The number of customers in the queue

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets the name of the service point.
      Returns:
      The service point name

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the service point.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name for the service point

    • hasQueueCapacity

      public boolean hasQueueCapacity(int maxCapacity)
      Checks if the service point has available queue capacity.
      Parameters:
      maxCapacity - Maximum allowed queue capacity (Integer.MAX_VALUE means unlimited)
      Returns:
      true if queue has capacity, false if at maximum capacity

    • finalizeStatistics

      public void finalizeStatistics()

    • getTotalCustomersServed

      public int getTotalCustomersServed()

      public double getTotalBusyTime()

      public double getAverageQueueLength(double simulationTime)

      public int getPeakQueueLength()

      public void resetStatistics()
